co.cask.cdap.api.flow

Interface FlowSpecification

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ProgramSpecification

    public interface FlowSpecification
extends ProgramSpecification
    This class provides the specification of a Flow. Instances of this class should be created through the FlowSpecification.Builder class by invoking the FlowSpecification.Builder.with() method.

    Example FlowSpecification: 

        
      public class PurchaseFlow implements Flow {
        @Override
        public FlowSpecification configure() {
          return FlowSpecification.Builder.with()
            .setName("PurchaseFlow")
            .setDescription("Reads user and purchase information and stores in dataset")
            .withFlowlets()
              .add("reader", new PurchaseStreamReader())
              .add("collector", new PurchaseStore())
            .connect()
              .fromStream("purchaseStream").to("reader")
              .from("reader").to("collector")
            .build();
        }
      }
    See the Cask DAP Developer Guide and the CDAP instance example applications.
    See Also:
    Flowlet
